title: New Terraform integrations from Dell, Fortinet, GitHub, Harness, Snyk, Splunk, and Zscaler
content:
As the HashiCorp Terraform ecosystem continues to expand, we welcome new integrations that provide additional options to Terraform Cloud, Enterprise, and open source users as they deploy and manage their cloud and on-premises infrastructure. Terraform is the world’s most widely used multi-cloud provisioning product. Whether you're deploying to Amazon Web Services (AWS), Microsoft Azure, Google Cloud, or on-premises data centers, Terraform can be a single control plane to provision and manage all your infrastructure.

Terraform Cloud and Terraform Enterprise integrations

HashiCorp announces six new Terraform Cloud and Terraform Enterprise integrations:

Aisera

Aisera provides an AI-powered platform that automates IT and customer service tasks by using natural language processing to understand and respond to user requests. Aisera's post-plan run task with Terraform Cloud monitors and escalates issues appropriately for quick remediation.

Cisco Systems

Cisco Systems, known for its computer networking products worldwide, offers the Cisco Nexus Dashboard to serve as the anchor of the Cisco Nexus 9000 portfolio. Nexus Dashboard Connector for HashiCorp Terraform bundles the Terraform Cloud Agent and is available as a free download for Nexus Dashboard customers using the Cisco DC App Center.

Concourse Labs

Concourse Labs helps organizations shift left with immediate visibility, protect development pipelines, and monitor cloud usage in real-time. The company's Terraform Cloud post-plan run task integrates Concourse Labs directly into the Terraform Cloud run cycle and provides visibility into post-plan execution.

Ermetic Ltd.

Ermetic provides holistic protection for AWS, Google, and Azure public clouds. The Ermetic Terraform Cloud integration allows customers to scan their Terraform plan before deployment to detect misconfigurations and risky entitlements.

GitHub App support on Terraform Enterprise

Terraform Enterprise users can now enable GitHub App authentication to connect current and future VCS resources (workspaces, policy sets, and private registry modules) to their Github App installations across the UI, API, or the Terraform Enterprise-provider. An instance of Terraform Enterprise can more securely authenticate with GitHub using GitHub app authentication. This integration gives Terraform Enterprise users more granular control of what VCS resources their Terraform Enterprise instance can access.

Harness

Harness is a self-service CI/CD platform that allows engineers and DevOps teams to build, test, deploy, and verify software, on-demand. The Harness Terraform Cloud connector connects with Terraform Cloud and helps users provision infrastructure in Harness pipelines and additionally deploy services to the provisioned infrastructure in the same pipeline.

SonarSource

SonarSource enables developers and development teams to write clean code and remediate existing code organically. SonarCloud's pre-plan run tasks for Terraform Cloud and Terraform Enterprise perform static analysis for CI/CD workflows triggered using Terraform Cloud.

Zscaler

Zscaler Zero Trust Exchange protects thousands of customers from cyberattacks and data loss by securely connecting users, devices, and applications in any location. Zscaler’s Posture Control integrated as a pre-plan run task allows users to help prevent misconfigurations, code leaks, environmental drift, and other cloud security issues, all in a single integrated platform.

Terraform providers

Announcing 16 new verified Terraform providers from our partners:

Dell

The Terraform provider for Dell Technologies PowerFlex allows datacenter and IT administrators to use Terraform to automate and orchestrate the provisioning and management of Dell PowerFlex storage systems.

The Terraform provider for Dell Technologies PowerStore allows datacenter and IT administrators to use Hashicorp Terraform to automate and orchestrate the provisioning and management of Dell PowerStore storage systems. The Terraform provider can be used to manage volumes, snapshot rules, protection policies, and storage containers.

Fortinet

Fortinet is a provider of enterprise-level next-generation firewalls and network security solutions. Its new Terraform FortiFlexVM provider interacts with resources supported by FortiFlexVM, including configurations and virtual machines. The FortiADC provider is used to interact with the resources supported by FortiADC, including firewalls, routers, systems, and users, etc.

Keyfactor

Keyfactor delivers identity-first security for every device, workload, and thing. The Keyfactor Terraform provider enables management of Keyfactor resources utilizing infrastructure as code (IaC) workflows.

Koyeb

Koyeb is a developer-friendly serverless platform designed to let businesses easily deploy reliable and scalable applications globally. The Koyeb Terraform provider enables developers to interact with and manage Koyeb resources such as apps, services, domains, and secrets as a part of their Terraform workflow.

MariaDB USA

MariaDB is a community-developed, commercially supported fork of the MySQL relational database management system. The MariaDB SkySQL Terraform provider automates your data infrastructure deployment by making it easy to provision, manage, and control configurations as code on Google Cloud or AWS through Terraform.

NetActuate

NetActuate provides high-availability, low-latency global infrastructure and BGP anycast from over 33 enterprise-class locations worldwide. The NetActuate Terraform provider enables users to provision and manage NetActuate resources, including servers, SSH keys, and BGP sessions.

Opal

Opal helps organizations prioritize risk, delegate management, and measure impact across security, productivity, and compliance. The Opal Terraform provider provides resources for managing Opal owners, resources, and groups.

Prosimo.io

Prosimo is a provider of multi-cloud networking solutions that help customers connect, manage, and secure their applications across multiple platforms. The Terraform provider for Prosimo is a Terraform plugin to enable full lifecycle management of Prosimo resources.

RackN

The RackN Digital Rebar platform scales IaC automation with reusable workflows that can be deployed on any platform. The RackN DRP Terraform provider replicates cloud-like behavior patterns from cloud service providers. This implementation focuses on enabling cloud-like behavior with pools to ensure Digital Rebar operators maintain control and visibility at all times.

Snyk

Snyk is a developer security platform integrating directly into development tools, workflows, and automation pipelines. The Snyk Terraform provider allows Terraform to manage Snyk resources.

Speakeasy

Speakeasy is a developer-first API ops platform that enables developers to offer best-in-class API DevEx to API consumers. The Speakeasy Terraform provider allows engineers to manage Speakeasy resources.

Splunk

Splunk delivers insights to unlock innovation, enhance security, and drive resilience with one platform addressing security and observability data needs. The Splunk Terraform provider supports the index resource for Splunk Cloud Platform deployments.

Timescale Inc

Timescale is a modern, cloud-native relational database platform for time-series built on TimescaleDB and PostgreSQL. The Timescale Terraform provider can be used to deploy and manage a TimescaleDB instance.

ZenLayer

Zenlayer offers on-demand edge cloud services in over 290 points of presence (PoPs) around the world. The Terraform provider for Zenlayer Cloud enables users to manage ZenlayerCloud bare-metal cloud infrastructure resources for edge computing services.

Zentral

Zentral is an open source hub for endpoint protection. Extensions are available for many agents; to deploy and configure them, and to collect, normalize and process the events they generate. The Terraform Zentral provider is a plugin for Terraform that allows for the full lifecycle management of Zentral resources.

Learn more about Terraform integrations

All integrations are available for review in the HashiCorp Terraform Registry. To verify an existing integration, please refer to our Terraform Cloud Integration Program.

If you haven’t already, try the free tier of Terraform Cloud to help simplify your Terraform workflows and management.
author: Nicole Bahr
